fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Budget, Competition, Consumers, Education and training, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Trans-European Networks, Borders and Security, Migration and asylum, European Neighbourhood Policy
eu_initiatives: Judicial Training: at EU level, the EJTN is best placed to coordinate, through its Members, national training activities and to develop a cross-border training offer for judges and prosecutors.
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
goals__remit:
Formed in 2000, the European Judicial Training Network (EJTN) is the principal platform and promoter for the training and exchange of knowledge of the European judiciary. International non-profit Association governed by the provisions of Belgian law, EJTN is a unique association in that it gathers the training institutions for the judiciary of all European Union Member States, thus representing the interests of over 160,000 European judges, prosecutors and judicial trainers across Europe. 
 
EJTN’s vision is to help fostering a common legal and judicial European culture. Its mandate is to help building a genuine European area of justice and to promote knowledge of legal systems, thereby enhancing the understanding, confidence and cooperation between judges and prosecutors within EU Member States. 
 
EJTN’s fields of interest include EU, civil, criminal and commercial law and linguistics and societal issues training. EJTN analyses and identifies training needs, develops training standards and curricula, coordinates judicial training exchanges and programmes, disseminates training expertise and promotes cooperation between EU judicial training institutions.
